body:
I perform an HTTP/1.1 call to envoy thru iptables. I expect envoy to connect to `nghttp2.org` by HTTP2,  by specifying `"features": "http"` in the cluster configuration. Envoy crushes on an assert:
`source/common/http/http2/codec_impl.cc:762] assert failure: frame->hd.type == NGHTTP2_HEADERS`.

My configuration:
```
{
  "listeners": [
    {
      "address": "tcp://0.0.0.0:80",
      "filters": [
        {
          "type": "read",
          "name": "http_connection_manager",
          "config": {
            "codec_type": "auto",
            "stat_prefix": "ingress_http",
            "route_config": {
              "virtual_hosts": [
                {
                  "name": "nghttp2",
                  "domains": ["nghttp2.org"],
                  "routes": [
                    {
                      "timeout_ms": 0,
                      "prefix": "/",
                      "cluster": "nghttp2"
                    }
                  ]
                }
              ]
            },
            "filters": [
              {
                "type": "decoder",
                "name": "router",
                "config": {}
              }
            ]
          }
        }
      ]
    },
    {
        "address": "tcp://0.0.0.0:15001",
        "filters": [],
        "bind_to_port": true,
        "use_original_dst": true
    }
  ],
  "admin": {
    "access_log_path": "/tmp/access_log",
    "address": "tcp://0.0.0.0:8001"
  },
  "cluster_manager": {
      "clusters": [
          {
              "name": "nghttp2",
              "connect_timeout_ms": 2500,
              "type": "strict_dns",
              "lb_type": "round_robin",
              "features": "http2",
              "hosts": [
                  {
                      "url": "tcp://nghttp2.org:80"
                  }
             ]
          }
    ]
  }
}
```

The client's command:
```
curl -v nghttp2.org
* Rebuilt URL to: nghttp2.org/
* Hostname was NOT found in DNS cache
*   Trying 139.162.123.134...
* Connected to nghttp2.org (139.162.123.134) port 80 (#0)
> GET / HTTP/1.1
> User-Agent: curl/7.35.0
> Host: nghttp2.org
> Accept: */*
> 
[2017-09-19 15:29:07.984][30][critical][assert] source/common/http/http2/codec_impl.cc:762] assert failure: frame->hd.type == NGHTTP2_HEADERS
```

Envoy's version: `b0d8095d0cd3c63667997124b9e8cee70d52f743/Clean/RELEASE`

The output of accessing `nghttp2.org` directly, **without Envoy**:
```
curl -v --http2 http://nghttp2.org
* Rebuilt URL to: http://nghttp2.org/
*   Trying 139.162.123.134...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to nghttp2.org (139.162.123.134) port 80 (#0)
> GET / HTTP/1.1
> Host: nghttp2.org
> User-Agent: curl/7.54.0
> Accept: */*
> Connection: Upgrade, HTTP2-Settings
> Upgrade: h2c
> HTTP2-Settings: AAMAAABkAARAAAAAAAIAAAAA
> 
< HTTP/1.1 101 Switching Protocols
< Connection: Upgrade
< Upgrade: h2c
* Received 101
* Using HTTP2, server supports multi-use
* Connection state changed (HTTP/2 confirmed)
* Copying HTTP/2 data in stream buffer to connection buffer after upgrade: len=27
* Connection state changed (MAX_CONCURRENT_STREAMS updated)!
< HTTP/2 200 
< date: Tue, 19 Sep 2017 15:26:54 GMT
< content-type: text/html
< last-modified: Fri, 18 Aug 2017 14:18:49 GMT
< etag: "5996f749-19e1"
< accept-ranges: bytes
< content-length: 6625
< x-backend-header-rtt: 0.001409
< server: nghttpx
< via: 2 nghttpx
< x-frame-options: SAMEORIGIN
< x-xss-protection: 1; mode=block
< x-content-type-options: nosniff
...
```
title: http/2: correctly disable/handle upstream push promise
